results.title: The Student prince
results.creator_credit: Richard Thorpe, Joe Pasternak and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Edmund Purdom and Ann Bltyh star in this romantic musical set to the music of Sigmund Romberg. Prince Karl is in love, but not with the princess he is supposed to wed in a state-arranged marriage. The object of his affections is a mere Heildberg barmaid. Mario Lanza provided the singing for the film.

results.title: Unforgiven
results.creator_credit: Clint Eastwood, Malpaso Company and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Clint Eastwood’s film is an exciting modern classic that rode off with four 1992 Academy Awards including Best Picture and Director. Eastwood and Morgan Freeman play retired down-on-their-luck outlaws who pick up their guns one last time to collect a bounty offered by the vengeful prostitutes of the remote Wyoming town of Big Whiskey. Richard Harris is an ill-fated interloper, a colourful killer for hire called English Bob. Gene Hackman is the sly and brutal local sheriff whose brand of law enforcement ranges from unconventional to ruthless. Big trouble is coming to Big Whiskey.

results.title: The Ploughman's lunch
results.creator_credit: Richard Eyre, Ann Scott, Simon Relph and Greenpoint Films
results.brief_description: Reporter James Penfield makes his money rearranging the facts, a talent he ruthlessly exploits in his friendship and love affairs. A political drama set against the backdrop of the Falkland’s crisis, the film takes a wry look at the Government’s attempt to justify the war. Set in the heartland of bourgeois England among media creators and academics, the personal, political and historical deceit of Thatcher’s Britain is ruthlessly exposed. Stars Jonathan Pryce and Tim Curry and features an astonishing climax as the crew and cast filmed undercover during the Conservative Party Conference.

results.title: The Witches (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Mark Shivas, Jim Henson Productions and Lorimar Film Entertainment
results.brief_description: When nine year old Luke and his grandmother go for a quiet seaside holiday, they stumble upon a witches’ convention, hosted by the Grand High Witch, (Angelica Huston). When Luke becomes a victim of the witches’ scheme to rid Britain of all its children, by transforming them into mice, he devises a plot with his grandmother to finally rid the world of witches. Based on the book by Roald Dahl.

results.title: Number 17 = Number seventeen
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock and British International Pictures
results.brief_description: This seldom seen and often maligned film is a pivotal one in Hitchcock’s career becoming a template for the thrillers to follow. More humourous in tone from Hitchcock’s later more obsessive films, it is replete with his trademark wry touches and unusual characters. Once again an unsuspecting innocent, this time a hobo, accidentally comes across something that places him in jeopardy and faces an encounter with a gang of jewel thieves. Cast includes Leon M. Lion, Anne Grey, John Stuart and Donald Calthorpe.

results.title: The Man who knew too much
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock, Sir Michael Balcon and Gaumont
results.brief_description: A child is kidnapped by spies to ensure his silence, but he springs into action. There are memorable sequences in the film involving a dentist, an East End mission and the Albert Hall. This film was later remade by Hitchcock in America but the earlier version is more acclaimed. Peter Lorre is excellent as the sneering villain. Cast also includes Leslie Banks and Edna Best.

results.title: Major league (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: David S. Ward, Irby Smith, Chris Chesser and Morgan Creek
results.brief_description: The recently widowed, and new owner of the Cleveland Indians has a plan: field the worst team ever, watch the attendance fall, then move the franchise to glorious sun-drenched Miami. So she signs a punk-pitcher (Charlie Sheen), a gimpy-kneed womanising catcher (Tom Berenger), a third-rate third baseman (Corbin Bernsen), the outfielder Willie May Hates (Wesley Snipes) and a ‘wayout’ field of other crazy misfits. The perfect plan? maybe not, but it is the perfect ingredients for this riotous and inspiring comedy.

results.title: Hello Dolly (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Gene Kelly, Ernest Lehman, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Chenault
results.brief_description: Barbra Streisand is a knockout as Dolly Levi, the woman “who arranges things… like furniture and daffodils and lives”. The plot concerns Dolly, a young widow and professional matchmaker who sets her sights and whatever else she can muster, on conquering tight-fisted Yonkers merchant, Horace Vandergelder, beautifully played by Walter Matthau. How she does it has to be the grandest musical there ever was! So, spend a magical evening with the incomparable Barbra and enjoy a great musicals. Also stars Michael Crawford.

results.title: Home alone (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Chris Columbus, John Hughes and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This is one of the most successful comedies of the eighties and stars pint-sized hero Macaulay Culkin. In a chaotic frenzy to get to the airport on time, the McCallister family forget one thing - eight year old Kevin. When two bungling burglars attempt to break into the McCallister household, Kevin is left home alone to defend himself and his house. He outwits the burglars by waging war the only way he knows how. A John Hughes film co-starring Joe Pesci, “Home alone” is a modern-day classic.

results.title: This boy's life
results.creator_credit: Michael Caton-Jones, Art Linson, Odyssey, Regency Enterprises and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: This is the captivating true story based on the book by Tobias Wolff. Growing up is never easy but for Tobias Wolff (Leonardo DiCaprio) it’s sheer hell. His mother, Caroline (Ellen Barkin), has just married Dwight Hansen (Robert De Niro), a psychotic disciplinarian who rules with an iron fist and an explosive temper. Instead of the bright future his mother promised him, Tobias must now endure constant brutality from his sadistic stepfather. There is a way out though; and with the will to fight and courage way beyond his years, Tobias just might find it. An absorbing and thoughtful story is brought to life by the gripping performances of the stars.
